dmca.title: Radio Shack not amused by radioslack.com
dmca.body:
Dear [Private]:

It has come to light that you are utilizing part of the "Radio Shack"
trademark, as part of your "RadioSlack.com" Website (See highlighted portion
of Attachment A).  The "Radio Shack" trademark is the property of TRS
Quality, Inc. and its sole licensee RadioShack Corporation.  The prominence
of the mark has caused it to be identified with RadioShack products and
services.  Be advised, you have no right to utilize this important portion
of the mark.  Your use of this designation infringes on the well-established
"Radio Shack" and "RadioShack" trademarks.

The federal registration for the stylized form of the "Radio Shack"
trademark was issued August 11, 1992 (See Attachment B).  The first use in
commerce of this mark occurred prior to 1975.  The "Radio Shack" trademark
was in use for years before "RadioSlack.com" existed.

TRS Quality, Inc. and RadioShack Corporation have expended a great deal of
time and money in developing and promoting the goodwill associated with the
"Radio Shack" and "RadioShack" trademarks.  Our trademarks appear on every
RadioShack-branded product throughout RadioShack's over 7,000 stores.  In
addition, the fact that the "Radio Shack" trademark is on the principal
register provides prima facie evidence of TRS Quality, Inc.'s exclusive
right to this trademark.

We are concerned that your use of "Radio Slack" as it currently appears (See
highlighted portion of Attachment A) will cause confusion as to sponsorship
of your Website, which is prohibited under the Lanham Act.  Your art is
obviously just our trademark with a slight alteration.  Further, we believe
that your continued use of our mark will result in dilution of our valuable
trademark, which is prohibited under the Federal Trademark Dilution Act of
1995.

Accordingly, RadioShack Corporation must insist that you immediately and
permanently replace "Radio Slack" with a different type or style - i.e., one
that is not suggestive of our trademarks.  Due to the importance of this
matter, please provide this office with written assurances of your
compliance no later than June 20, 2002.

Nothing contained in this letter, nor any act or omission to act by
RadioShack is intended or should be deemed to be a waiver, abridgment,
alteration, modification or reduction of any rights or remedies that
RadioShack may have in regard to this matter and all such rights and
remedies, whether at law or in equity, are hereby expressly reserved.


Sincerely,



[private]
Trademark Attorney

[private]
